metadata.title: CVE-2018-5115 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
If an HTTP authentication prompt is triggered by a background networkrequest from a page or extension, it is displayed over the currently loadedforeground page. Although the prompt contains the real domain making therequest, this can result in user confusion about the originating site ofthe authentication request and may cause users to mistakenly send privatecredential information to a third party site. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
